name: backstreet
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
on a small, quiet street, often in an older or poorer area of a town or city: In backstreet houses in this Cuban town men make hand-rolled cigars. Like other big companies, they cut costs by switching to cheap, small suppliers in backstreet sweatshops. See
backstreets
More examplesFewer examplesWe had dinner at a friendly backstreet restaurant.The manufacturer is gaining a reputation for constructing solid machines, at prices competitive with all but the smallest backstreet operation. There are a couple of cafés in the main square and plenty of nameless backstreet bars.
